page.title: 10ORIGINS: QUINTON
page.content: There is ample proof that Quinton and Marston existed far back in history. Quinton was recorded in the{Domesday Book as Quinentune, derived from the Saxon{'Quean',}indicating the existence of a{'place for women'}or nunnery. There are traces of{Iron Age and {Bronze Age}settlements on{Meon Hill, and the ancient{'ridge and furrow ' legacy is quite clearly visible. It would appear that earlier people inhabited first the upper parts of Meon Hill, and then moved further down through history. Over the last half-century, the quiet hamlets have become quite large villages, especially since the arrival of the army at Long Marston.
